title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Bethel University
Interview Descriptions:
Phone interview was less on your work skills, & more focused on your relationship with Christ. Asked questions that, even for a Christian university, were very personal. 

Did not receive any communication from Bethel after interviewing, not even an email.
Interview Questions:
What does your faith mean to you?

Others similar to this.

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Bethel University (Saint Paul, MN) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: Pre-Screen interview of about 30 minutes, followed by an hourlong interview with direct supervisor, an hourlong interview with direct supervisor and their supervisor, and a 45 minute interview with supervisor and coworker team. Very fast process, start to finish in 10 days--great interviewers and straightforward expectations.
Interview Questions: Why Bethel and not UNWSP?

title: Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Bethel University
Interview Descriptions: The process was very thorough, there was a pre-screening exam that measured my customer service skills. I also had two interviews before being  hired.  Unfortunately, it felt like the process took a long time.
Interview Questions: How do you handle conflict?

title: Content Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Bethel University (Saint Paul, MN) in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions: They had an initial phone interview, a panel video interview, and a writing assignment. The phone interview was about 30 minutes and the Indian woman on the phone was almost unintelligible. The panel video interview was intense because it was a full hour with the hiring manager and another employee plus an additional half hour with the content team. It seemed a little pointless because they seem like the type of company to hire who they want, regardless of who's actually the most qualified.
Interview Questions: They asked pretty standard questions about skills and experience. Nothing too weird or wacky.

title: Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Bethel University in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: This was a fair process with no issue. There was no spark on either side which is why the lack of a call back was not an issue. The institution was fair.
Interview Questions: Remote work capabilities as an option

title: Enrollment Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Bethel University (Arden Hills, MN) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: Initial ~30min HR interview, followed a couple weeks later by a one hour 2-on-1 interview with the Director and the Associate Director. The interviews felt relatively casual, with an openness for me to ask questions throughout.
Interview Questions: How would you pitch this program to a prospective student - what would you highlight if you had 30 seconds to a minute?

title: Position In Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Bethel University (Saint Paul, MN) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview with HR, then half day with team leaders and various staff. For communications people, two of the "leaders" didn't communicate very well. One giggled throughout and I felt that she was mocking me. The staff interview was unprofessional.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you were asked to do one thing and someone else asked you to do something else?

title: Resident Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Bethel University (Saint Paul, MN)
Interview Descriptions: Interview process involved three steps.  First interview was with an HR representative.  Second interview was with Bethel staff.  Third and last interview was a day-long interview with staff, students, and management.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a Resident Director?

title: Chemistry Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Bethel University (Saint Paul, MN) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was not a very long process, but it took a while for a response due to throwing my name out so early. I had talked to a professor I knew well about an opportunity doing research and from there the compiled a list and narrowed down who was chosen for research opportunities. Faculty then asked students if they would like to work with the specifically.
Interview Questions: How many years of college had I completed and what classes I had taken.

title: Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Bethel University
Interview Descriptions: Had at least three people to interview me. Could tell right off the bat that this employer didn't have a clue as to what they were doing.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in three years with the company/

title: Senior Development Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Bethel University (San Diego, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Was a long process but all went well.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Bethel University
Interview Descriptions: The current Student managers will choose student employees who they see would make a good candidate for the student manager position. They then discuss with one another who they think will make a good leader, and then suggest to individuals they should apply. Once they have applied and the references are in, the student employee manager will go through an evaluation and interviewing process and then they will be sent a letter informing them of their welcome on the team, or that they have not been chosen for the position.
Interview Questions: If you were a character in a book, which character would you be.

title: Community Relations Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Bethel University (Saint Paul, MN) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: By community members and administrator. They always seemed to be in conflict.
Interview Questions: How do you feel about working with Asians or Black people.
